Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Curriculum \Cur*ric"u*lum\ (k?r-r?k"?-l?m), n.; pl. E. {Curriculums} (-l?mz), L. {Curricula} (-l[.a]). [L. See {Curricle}.] [1913 Webster] 1. A race course; a place for running. [1913 Webster]
2. A course; particularly, a specified fixed course of study, as in a university. [1913 Webster]
curriculum n : an integrated course of academic studies; "he was admitted to a new program at the university" [syn: {course of study}, {program}, {programme}, {syllabus}] [also: {curricula} (pl)]
